players.name: Alice
memory: You're Alice, the villager.
Night 1 begins.
The villager Bob was found dead.
Day 1 begins.
Charlie: "Bob’s death is weird—he was a safe, quiet target. Diana, can you share any reads or checks? Alice, what’s your take on who benefits most from killing Bob?"

You: "Bob dying N1 suggests the killer wanted low info. Diana, if you’re the detective, please share a result (even a N0/no check). Charlie, why did you pre-emptively ask Diana specifically? Feels agenda-driven."
Diana: "Charlie is the mafioso. I investigated him last night. Please vote Charlie today. Alice, trust this and lock it in."

Charlie: "Slow down—Diana, if you’re real, why investigate me N1 over Alice? Alice, does this timing feel too perfect? If I flip town, we auto-lose. Let’s no-lynch today and reassess votes from night info."

You: "Charlie’s push for a no-lynch when we’re 4->3 is anti-town. Diana hard-claims detective with a check on Charlie—this is the highest-value info we’ll get. I’m voting Charlie. If Diana’s lying, we lose anyway."
Diana: "Charlie is confirmed mafia from my N1 check. No-lynch only helps him. Alice, stay on Charlie. Town wins if we execute him now. Charlie’s deflection and no-lynch push are classic scum plays."
Votes: Alice voted for Charlie, Charlie voted for Diana, Diana voted for Charlie
Charlie was arrested
